verbs.description: [V: s] f schools struggle with more homeless kids homelessness s f educators struggle to help rising number of cold hungry sleepy students in classrooms last week he was sleeping on the floor at a san francisco drop - in homeless shelter with his parents and 3-year - old brother danny in the last two months he spent three nights at a bus shelter and a week on the streets sleeping on his parents laps in a park rudy is among a growing number of san francisco schoolchildren in homeless families who too often come to class cold hungry and sleep - deprived making learning difficult if not impossible in the city public schools there are 2 200 homeless children some in shelters others in cars or on couches or in long - term hotel rooms yet in the spring these homeless children will take the same standardized test as students in hillsborough piedmont and beverly hills where every physical and academic need is met danny fairmount elementary school jessica chiarchiaro spring valley elementary school rudy nguyen san francisco unified school district san francisco
